description: Configuration management including service categories, API constants, and database seeding infrastructure

components.ServiceCategoryConfig: Data class defining service category configuration with ID, display name, color, and icon properties.

components.ServiceCategories: Static configuration manager for service categories with database loading, defaults, and color/icon management.

rules: Centralized service category configuration with color and icon management system.
Database-driven configuration loading with fallback to sensible defaults.
Default color mapping: nails (blue), gel (light blue), acrylic (purple), waxing (green), facials (amber), SNS (orange), massage (deep purple), hair (red), other (grey).
Material Design icon integration with category-appropriate icon selection.
Numeric ID to category name mapping for backward compatibility with database schema.
Dynamic category loading from database with proper color parsing from hex strings.
Icon name string to IconData mapping for database-stored icon configurations.
Category update functionality for runtime color customization and configuration changes.
Fallback 'other' category ensuring all services have valid category assignment.
Default initialization system preventing null reference errors during app startup.
Color parsing with error handling for malformed hex color values.
Category retrieval with case-insensitive matching and fallback behavior.
Database integration methods for loading categories from stored data.
Static utility methods for color retrieval by category ID or name.
Professional color palette with visually distinct category identification.
Icon mapping system supporting common Material Design icons for service categories.
Configuration update system supporting runtime theme and appearance changes.

components.ApiConstants: Static constants class defining REST API endpoints and URL construction methods for backend integration.

rules: Centralized API endpoint definition for consistent backend communication.
localhost:8096 base URL configuration for development environment.
RESTful endpoint structure with proper resource naming and HTTP method alignment.
Authentication endpoints: login, logout, refresh token for session management.
Customer CRUD endpoints with search functionality and parameterized ID routing.
Employee management endpoints (updated from technicians) with status tracking.
Service and service category endpoints for menu and pricing management.
Ticket lifecycle endpoints: queue management, assignment, checkout operations.
Payment processing endpoints for transaction management and history.
Appointment management with availability checking and check-in functionality.
Location-based endpoints for multi-location business support.
Settings and business information endpoints for configuration management.
Comprehensive reporting endpoints: sales, customers, technicians analytics.
Synchronization endpoints for data consistency and offline support.
Parameterized endpoint methods using string interpolation for dynamic routing.
Private constructor preventing instantiation of constants class.
Environment-ready structure supporting development, staging, production configurations.

components.ServiceCategorySeeds: Database seeding utility providing default service categories with colors, icons, and category mapping.

rules: Comprehensive default service category seeding for new database installations.
Pre-configured service categories: Mani-Pedi, Gel Nails, Acrylics, Waxing, Facial, SNS with appropriate colors and icons.
Professional color scheme with visually distinct category identification: soft pink, teal, purple, orange, green, bright orange.
Material Design icon mapping: pan_tool (mani-pedi), brush (gel), format_paint (acrylics), spa (waxing), face (facial), layers (SNS).
Intelligent seeding logic checking for existing categories before insertion.
Batch insertion for optimal database performance during seeding operations.
Category color and icon update functionality for database maintenance.
Backward compatibility support with numeric ID to category name mapping.
Comprehensive logging integration for seeding status and error tracking.
Error handling with rethrow for proper exception propagation.
Database transaction safety with batch operations for consistency.
Category name variations mapping for flexible service assignment.
Default category assignment ensuring all services have valid categorization.
Professional salon service categorization matching industry standards.
Drift ORM integration with Companion objects for type-safe database operations.
Hex color storage format with '#' prefix for consistent color representation.
Icon name storage as strings with Material Design icon mapping.

components.ServiceSeeds: Comprehensive service seeding utility providing default salon services with realistic pricing, durations, and categorization.

rules: Professional salon service catalog with 40+ realistic services across 6 categories.
Industry-standard service categorization: Mani-Pedi (1), Gel Nails (2), Acrylics (3), Waxing (4), Facial (5), SNS (6).
Realistic pricing structure: $10-95 range matching current salon market rates.
Appropriate service durations: 10-90 minutes based on actual service complexity.
Complete service descriptions providing clear service value propositions.
Diverse service offerings: basic to luxury tiers including deluxe, hot stone, CBD options.
Demographic-specific services: men's services, children's services with appropriate pricing.
Comprehensive waxing menu: eyebrow, facial, body, bikini services with progressive pricing.
Advanced facial treatments: anti-aging, hydrating, acne treatment, brightening options.
SNS/dip powder services: full sets, fills, french, ombre with specialty pricing.
Batch insertion optimization for efficient database seeding operations.
Service category update functionality for database maintenance and corrections.
Existing service check to prevent duplicate seeding on multiple runs.
Comprehensive logging for seeding status, success counts, and error tracking.
Service-to-category mapping for automated category assignment corrections.
Error handling with rethrow for proper exception propagation and debugging.
Database transaction safety with batch operations for data consistency.
Professional service naming conventions matching salon industry standards.
